 Volume of a sound that is currently playing.

Detailed Description

AudioDeviceBase is the base class for AudioPlayers and SimpleAudioDevices (including the speech device). An AudioDeviceBase supports changing volume, muting, and querying and execution of generic features. Usually, an AudioDeviceBase corresponds to some piece of hardware, and should be implemented as a singleton.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef INT AudioDeviceBase::Feature
 

Uniquely identifies a feature that a device may support. Extension (non-predefined) values must avoid overlap (with predefined values and among each other).

typedef AudioReference::VolumeLevel AudioDeviceBase::VolumeLevel
 

See volume concept documentation.

Audio Error codes that can be sent to applications. Used in AudioStoppedMsg

Enumerator:
NoErrorType  No error.
FileOperationErrorType  File operation error.
InvalidFormatErrorType  Invalid format error.
GeneralErrorType  General error.

enum AudioDeviceBase::MuteDirection
 

Enumerator:
UplinkDirection  mute/unmute uplink
DownlinkDirection  mute/unmute downlink
UpDownlinkDirection  mute/unmute both uplink and downlink

enum AudioDeviceBase::PredefinedFeature
 

Predefined values for Feature.

Enumerator:
SetTimeFeature 
GetTimeFeature 
MmfSuspendFeature 
MmfResumeFeature 
GenericFastForward  Used for fast forward - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x is the rate of fast forward data.SetActiveReference(y); where y is the active reference to apply fast forward

To resume normal playback this feature has to be executed again with data.SetNumber(0);

When fast forward has started, a message is sent containing the active reference: AudioFastForwardStartedMsg

If the end of the file is reached during fast forward the sound will be stopped and a message will be sent: AudioStoppedMsg

Please be aware that executing this feature has no effect if the sound is in suspended or stopped state

GenericRewind  Used for rewind - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x is the rate of rewind data.SetActiveReference(y); where y is the active reference to apply rewind

To resume normal playback this feature has to be executed again with data.SetNumber(0);

When rewind has started, a message is sent containing the active reference: AudioRewindStartedMsg

If the begin of the file is reached during rewind the sound will be stopped and a message will be sent: AudioStoppedMsg

Please be aware that executing this feature has no effect if the sound is in suspended or stopped state

GenericGetTrackInfo  Used to get the track info of a sound - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetActiveReference(x); where x is the active reference

The track info will be returned in the GenericFeatureData object.

For further information regarding the available information please have a look at the structure GenericTrackInfo which is defined in the class GenericFeatureData

Please be aware that executing this feature has no effect if the sound is in stopped state

MmfGetAudioTrackInfo  Used to get the "multimedia framework specific" track info of a sound - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetActiveReference(x); where x is the active reference

The track info will be returned as a pointer which is accessible by calling: MediaInfo::AudioTrackInfo* track_info = (MediaInfo::AudioTrackInfo*)data.GetDataPtr();

For further information regarding the available information please have a look at the documentation of MediaInfo::AudioTrackInfo.

Please be aware that executing this feature has no effect if the sound is in stopped state

FmRadioSeekStationFeature  Used to seek for a radio station - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x is the seek direction

To seek up, set the value 0. To seek down, set the value 1.

FmRadioSetStationFeature  Used to set a radio station - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x is the frequency of the radio station in Hertz

Example: To set the station 88.8 MHz set the value 88800000.

FmRadioRssiLevelFeature  Used to subscribe to/unsubscribe from RSSI notification - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x enables/disables the subscription

To subscribe, set the value 1. To unsubscribe, set the value 0.

If the RSSI level changes, the message AudioFmRadioRssiMsg will be sent. The message contains the following information: The signal level as UINT8. Mono/Stereo as BOOLEAN.

FmRadioRdsFeature  Used to basically enable/disable RDS data decoding - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x enables/disables RDS decoding

To enable RDS decoding, set the value 1. To disable RDS decoding, set the value 0.

If the selected radio station sends RDS data, the message AudioFmRadioRdsInfoMsg will be sent containing basic information about the radio station.

FmRadioRdsStationNameFeature  Used to enable/disable decoding of the station name - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x enables/disables station name decoding

To enable station name decoding, set the value 1. To disable station name decoding, set the value 0.

If the station is decoded successfully, the message AudioFmRadioRdsStationNameMsg will be sent containing station name.

Please be aware that decoding the station name only works if the feature FmRadioRdsFeature is enabled as well.

FmRadioRdsRadioTextFeature  Used to enable/disable decoding of the radio text - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x enables/disables radio text decoding

To enable radio text decoding, set the value 1. To disable radio text decoding, set the value 0.

The message AudioFmRadioRdsRadioTextMsg will be sent regularly containing the decoded parts of the radio text.

Please be aware that decoding the radio text only works if the feature FmRadioRdsFeature is enabled as well.

FmRadioRdsRawDataFeature  Used to enable/disable sending the raw RDS data - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x enables/disables sending the RDS raw data

To enable sending the raw data, set the value 1. To disable sending the raw data, set the value 0.

The message AudioFmRadioRdsRawDataMsg will be sent regularly containing the raw RDS data.

Please be aware that sending the raw data only works if the feature FmRadioRdsFeature is enabled as well. Additionally, the receiver of the message has to take care of deleting the allocated memory of the buffer which is sent in the message.

FmRadioRdsAlternativeFrequenciesFeature  Used to enable/disable decoding alternative frequencies - the following members have to set in the GenericFeatureData object which has to be passed when executing the feature: data.SetNumber(x); where x enables/disables decoding alternative frequencies

To enable decoding alternative frequencies, set the value 1. To disable decoding alternative frequencies, set the value 0.

The message AudioFmRadioRdsAlternativeFrequenciesMsg will be sent regularly containing the currently available alternative frequencies.

Please be aware that decoding alternative frequencies only works if the feature FmRadioRdsFeature is enabled as well. Additionally, the receiver of the message has to take care of deleting the allocated memory of the buffer which is sent in the message.

PredefinedFeatureEnd

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::ApplyDeviceVolume (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Reimplemented in MmfPlayer, and SpeechSimpleAudioDevice.

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::ApplyMasterVolume (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

virtual BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::ExecuteFeature (  Feature  feature,
GenericObject *  data = 0
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Executes the feature using the supplied data. The device should check whether it is getting the kind of data it expects using the mechanisms of GenericObject. The effects of executing the feature are not specified here, and can be freely specified by the device.

Parameters:
feature identifies the feature.
data feature-specific data. The feature implementation and feature clients have to agree on this.
Returns:
TRUE if the request could be made successfully.

Reimplemented in MmfPlayer.

virtual UINT16 AudioDeviceBase::GetDeviceID (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Get the unique device ID used whenever the resource is allocated (not used in casse of speech device since the allocation is done by MN process).

Implemented in MapiAudioPlayer, AudioVibratorDevice, and MmfPlayer.

AudioDeviceBase::VolumeLevel AudioDeviceBase::GetVolume_Specific (  const AudioReference &  audio_ref  )  [protected]

virtual BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::IsFeatureSupported (  Feature  feature,
MimeType  mime_type = c_mime_unknown,
AudioReference::SoundDataSource  sound_data_source = AudioReference::InvalidSoundDataSource
)  const [inline, virtual]
 

Queries the device whether it supports the feature.

Parameters:
feature identifies the feature.
mime_type the mime type for which support is queried. The default means the feature has to be supported for all mime types.
sound_data_source the SoundDataSource for which support is queried. The default means the feature has to be supported for all SoundDataSources.
Returns:
TRUE if the feature is supported for the supplied mime type and SoundDataSource.

Reimplemented in MmfPlayer.

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::SetDeviceVolume (  VolumeLevel  volume  ) 
 

Sets device volume. See volume concept doc.

Parameters:
volume volume to be set
Returns:
TRUE for success

Sets master volume. See volume concept doc.

Parameters:

Returns:
TRUE for success

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::SetMute (  BOOLEAN  enable = TRUE,
MuteDirection  direction = UpDownlinkDirection
)  [virtual]
 

Mutes or unmutes the device.

Parameters:
enable TRUE mutes the device. When mute is disabled (using FALSE), the last volume setting will be used.
direction Determines whether the uplink, downlink, or both are affected.
Returns:
TRUE indicates success.
Note:
For master mute use AudioDeviceBaseManager::EnableMasterMute()

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceBase::SetVolume (  VolumeLevel  volume  ) 
 

Deprecated, use SetDeviceVolume instead.
